articles.title: North Andover officer shot by colleague back in jail just days after release
articles.description:
Kelsey Fitzsimmons claimed that her injuries prevented her from submitting to alcohol testing. A judge ordered her to return to jail, saying that testing was needed to ensure public safety.

The post North Andover officer shot by colleague back in jail just days after release appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Kelsey Fitzsimmons returned to jail after failing to comply with alcohol testing requirements.
A judge mandated her return to custody for public safety on September 12, 2025.
This incident raises concerns about accountability among law enforcement in North Andover.

articles.title: The owners of the orange dinosaur are suing Saugus. Here’s why.
articles.description:
The developers behind Essex Landing accuse the town of delaying their project and pressuring them to pay $200,000 to move forward.

The post The owners of the orange dinosaur are suing Saugus. Here’s why. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Developers of Essex Landing are suing Saugus over project delays.
The town allegedly pressured them to pay $200,000 to proceed.
Local residents may face project setbacks affecting community development.

articles.title: Heidi Watney happily returns to Fenway with Apple TV+ for Yankees-Red Sox: ‘It’s like coming home’
articles.description:
Watney was part of NESN's Red Sox coverage from 2008-11.

summary: Heidi Watney returns to Fenway Park for Yankees-Red Sox game on Apple TV+.

Her return enhances local sports coverage for Boston fans on streaming platforms.

articles.title: Brian Walshe reportedly stabbed in jail while awaiting murder trial
articles.description:
Walshe has since been discharged from the hospital and returned to Norfolk County Jail, per multiple media reports.

summary: Brian Walshe was stabbed in Norfolk County Jail while awaiting his murder trial.
Walshe has been discharged from the hospital and returned to jail.
This incident raises concerns about inmate safety in Boston's correctional facilities.

articles.title: Former Patriots players share drastic measures Bill Belichick would take for team’s trips to Miami

articles.title: Boston College seeks a more balanced offense, and other keys to its late-night football showdown at Stanford

A more varied offense could enhance Boston College's competitiveness in upcoming games.

articles.title: The Patriots may be in a better situation than the Dolphins, but will it matter on Sunday in Miami?
articles.description:
The Dolphins have plenty of talent, no chemistry, communicate with each other through the media way too often, and are coming off a 33-8 pasting by the Colts.

The post The Patriots may be in a better situation than the Dolphins, but will it matter on Sunday in Miami? appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Patriots face Dolphins on Sunday, September 17, 2023, in Miami.
Dolphins lost 33-8 to the Colts, raising concerns about team chemistry.
Local fans hope Patriots capitalize on Dolphins' struggles for a win.
